headline: How Ananym Capital’s Push for a Breakup at Baker Hughes (BKR) Has Changed Its Investment Story
summary: Earlier in November 2025, activist investor Ananym Capital publicly called for Baker Hughes to spin out its oilfield services and equipment business, aiming to unlock shareholder value by realizing a higher sum-of-parts valuation. This announcement marks a significant shift, as Ananym expressed willingness to press management for decisive action, signaling the potential for upcoming structural changes at Baker Hughes. We’ll examine how activist calls for a business separation could impact...
